data.text:
@makubob Ok, the one the kid has in the article is fucking TRAUMATIZING LOLOLOLOLOL.

I'm really sensitive to medication/shots in general, so my doctor gave me anti-flammables as a precaution ^_^
@xoLadyArchangel https://t.co/xzbPKrfM5X might help, looks similar and time frame is about right as well.
@SilentUschi I’m at the doctors now getting it checked out, I’ll let you know if it’s anything spoopy to tell your friend D:
@xoLadyArchangel My lovely friend said her arm looks the exact same !!
@xoLadyArchangel That's super weird. I hope your appointment goes well
@JodyEcho I have an appointment today ^_^ I feel completely fine, it just itches and it’s uncomfortable

@xoLadyArchangel I have gotten plenty of shots before and they have never lingered for weeks. I would personally pay attention to my heart beats, breathing rhythm, vision, and smell. If no changes, don't go to the dr, but if there is any negative changes, you better go to the Dr ASAP
@xoLadyArchangel 2 weeks is a while, I would consult a doctor/nurse.

@xoLadyArchangel there are always going to be soreness and redness from the injection site for most shots. Some people heal in differently. Unless it is giving you issues I would not be worried about it. But I am not a doctor so If you have concerns I would see  your doctor.
